## Project Overview

Build a hybrid book recommendation system that combines:

-   Content-Based Filtering (TF_IDF): book metadata

-   Collaborative Filtering (item-based KNN): user rating patterns

= Hybrid score

# Data Sources

## Books.csv

ISBN

Book-Title

Book-Author

Year-Of-Publication

Publisher

Image-URL-S

Image-URL-M

Image-URL-L

## Ratings.csv

-   User-ID

-   ISBN

-   Book-Rating

# Approach and Mining Methods

## Data Cleaning

-   Standardized column names for both datasets

-   Normalized text fields for TF-IDF tokenization

    -   "harry potter" vs. "Harry Potter".

-   Removed in Ratings.csv

    -   Ratings set at 0

## Data Cleaning cont.

-   Removed in Books.csv:

    -   Invalid publication years

    -   Rows with missing values for Book_Author and Publisher

    -   Books published by Scholastic or Random House Books for Young Readers

    -   Known foreign-language publishers

## EDA

-   Removed outliers in Year_Of_Publication

-   Outliers in ratings per user and ratings per book

-   Removed ISBNs with no metadata

-   Merged Books.csv and Ratings.csv by User_ID

-   Filtered out books \< 5 ratings and users \< 5 ratings

## Modeling Decisions

Content-based filtering:

-   TF-IDF matrix

-   Indexed book catalog

-   Combined Book_Title, Book_Author, and Publisher

Collaborative filtering:

-   User-item rating matrix

-   Surprise's item-item cosine similarity

## Modeling Decisions cont.

Hybrid:

-   Similarity score from both the CBF and CF

$$
\text{HybridSim}(i, j)
= \alpha \cdot \text{ContentSim}(i, j)
+ 1 - \alpha) \cdot \text{CFSim}(i, j)
$$
